Judge  who  heard  the  case  up  to  that  point  was  transferred.  Hence  a  new
High Court Judge had resumed the trial on 15/05/2012 and continued the
trial after adopting the proceedings led up to that point.
When  the  case  was  proceeding,  the  second  High  Court  Judge  also  got
transferred.  Hence
10/05/2016 after adopting the proceedings led up to that point.
Finally, the case was concluded before the judge who wrote the judgment.
He too had properly adopted the proceedings on 21/07/2017 and continued
the trial.
Although it has been the practice of the judges of our courts to formally adopt
the proceedings of their predecessor, I find no such specific requirement in
Section 48 of the Judicature Act amended by the Amendment Act No. 27 of
1990. What is necessary in a criminal prosecution is to continue with the
case  and  it  was  up  to  the  accused  to  demand  that  the  witnesses  be  re-
summoned and reheard which has not happened in this case. Hence, I find
no merit in this ground of appeal.
